column4: I have a question regarding Precise Penguin... For some reason I have been defaulted to the 2D graphics settings and I can't find the option for 3D. The reason I need 3D is so I can use keyboard combos such as alt-tab. Anyone know a fix?
3D does not show in the gear drop down at login, are you short a graphic driver?
- When I go to keyboard settings, all of the bindings are disabled mostly
is it mounted
yes
do i need to set a boot flag?
whats the partition format?
ntfs with nothing on it
hmm fat 32 is what you want I believe
is it because win xp is older?
ISO are generally run a fat32 and with unetbootin
gotcha thanks :) you're always helpful.
is your rank in the forum linked to your irc rank?
Not that I know of, I'm not even active on the forum, but support it.
I saw your name on a few forum posts thats why I asked, you seemed active.
I have over 8000 posts I believe I was for some time.
Make sure the one OS saved has grub control if you have other OS's with grub
ok how do I check? I am really just doing this to increase the partition size of the one OS i actually use
In the one you want saved run sudo grub-install /dev/sdX   X is the HD.  What ever OS is at the top of the grub list if not modified has the control.
yea the one at the top is the one I am saving so it should have the grub
Yep,
I use ubuntu tweak personally to remove kernels, i could do it from the terminal or synaptic,  but I'm lazy.
gotcha, I'll use that I suppose
and loadid thanks :)
never heard of it I think it is a personal journey man, use what works for you.

I mean it is basically a book that shows you how to start from scratch with building a linux OS. I just thought it would be interesting and helpful for learning the background of the filesystem etc. A little more hands on
Might be, I learned the little I really know from using it and lurking the UF until I could help same here. I am not a person who wants to be a IT person persay though.
you were telling me how to delete the extra kernels the other day, you said you use tweak, which part of tweak is that option?
click the start janitor you will see the cleanup list.
It will remove all but the one you are using so if you want at least two sets which is generally advised look close.
yea I see it, well organized, I like it
easy cleaning for sure.
gparted will show you partitions you just have to know which is which.
You can't lable a partition you are using from gparted though.
I mean I've labeled them before, just given them kernel names so this wouldn't happen again
So maybe you can give us the end goal here that might be helpful.
essentially I am trying to get rid of one partition and resize another, I just don't wanna do the wrong ones
Ah so you don't know the partition of the OS that you want to keep?
correct :), as well as the other one I want to resize. I have sda and sdb too (2 HD's)
not that it's important, but it's making it a bit more confusing to me.
If you run sudo update-grub it will list the OS, the one you want as I remember has grub control so the one to remove will show it's partition
gotcha I'll give it a shot
Probably easier ways, I just have never been in that situation as I remember anyway, and I only know the commands I use regularly, and google for any not known. ;)
Follow Jordan_U that be some fine help. ;)
is a swap partition necessary for just 1 OS per HD?
swap has two basic uses, first if you are running the ram to the limit and second if you want to hibernate, personally I use a swap that builds itself as needed in the OS, I never hibernate.
I use swapspace it just makes a swap when needed in the OS, I rarely need use of a swap so it works fine for me.
so you think 2 gb is a solid size? Even though I guess it's based on ram
That would be correct I only have 2 gigs ram, and the only time it is really used is with virtualbox running.
generally a swap equal to ram is suggested, unless you have a astronomical amount of ram.
yea I know I reset unity in terminal, could that have been the issue?
What release is this 12.10
Specificities are helpful. ;)

my man, whats up, well for example, the way you can scroll up and down on your mousewheel on unity and it does that smooth animation. It doesn't do that very successfully any more, meaning it seems like the framerate is low.
I'm not sure I can help I use gnome 3 myself, and am in W7 at the moment. ;)
mk well there's the problem, ubuntu just crashed due to the x server I believe. Are you very familiar with nvidia?
Not really I have never had to mess with them.
you may be able to help with the second part of ^
I would say that messing with compiz can cause problems, ou can reset it to stock though.
I can't say if it is the root of the problem though.
You want to run that command from a alt-f2 not the terminal.
ahhh, so do you think that is the root of the problem? or at least for the unity issue?
as well there is compiz --replace to reset it.  Not sure as far as all the problems
ok I think that should work, should both commands be done in alt f2? or does compiz not matter
I gave up on unity and compiz about a year ago.
what are you using now? docky or something?
gnome 3 and cairo dock
the gnome-shell
hmm I'd be willing to try that out, Unity still feels like it's in beta to me.
Honestly I use synapse to find apps usually and the cairo-dock for the stuff I open often.
yea I do have synapse, It's just sitting there right now though haha, wouldn't mind using it for once.
any place in particular to find gnome 3? I think at this point you already know how new I am to this stuff
If you want to install it, sudo apt-get install gnome-shell  you also get the gnome fallback with kit as well the pseudo gnome 2 desktop as a choice in the login drop down
Unity actually sits on top of gnome 3 so the shell is just a few more pckgs.
well apparently I already have it *facepalm*
haha yea I guess I'm good then, just need cairo and to get rid of the excess.
any particular way I should remove unity and compiz? I feel like everything I try and get rid of on here is like removing an antivirus program on windows.
I would not remove them they are rather small, and doing this is just a problem waiting to happen with dependencies.
ok well I guess I will just reset them then like you said, btw cairo is awesome great call.
I like the cairo-dock as far as docks go.
so is there anyway to at least make unity not visible? I'd rather not have 2 docks
Try the gnome shell that is where I use the cairo-dock.
ah so you mean at login just changing there, gotcha. Thanks bud :]
do you know much about changing the icons on cairo? Essentially I wanted to just replace the program 'guake' with the terminal program but leaving the terminal icon there.
I forget if I did. ;)
haha alright, not that important thanks.
have you tried cairo-dock 3.1?
I would use the cli and apt-fast.
for what?
For getting apps, it is faster, but if your looking for a gui you can try deepin.
ah alright thanks
^^^^ as wildc4rd
